job.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <strong><u>That Means You Will<br><br></u></strong>As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will join a team of passionate developers and testers to design, develop, test, and integrate applications of high complexity. We operate in a collaborative, open environment focused on using Agile development techniques to autonomously deliver solutions quickly and effectively.<br><ul><li>Develop and support high-quality API centric software solutions</li><li>Drive, influence, and support API quality standards</li><li>Provide technical leadership and coaching to junior team members</li><li>Establish a culture of software craftsmanship best practices, including Test Driving/Automation, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Deployment</li><li>Engage in Agile software development activities, including sprint planning, daily standups, retrospectives, and hackathons</li><li>Interface regularly with customers to ensure technical solutions are meeting needs</li><li>Collaborate with other teams to drive alignment on product requirements and resulting development execution plans</li><li>Collaborate with Architecture and Product Leads to drive product and technology roadmaps</li><li> 7 or more years of experience in Java application development </li><li> 3 or more years of experience developing with RESTful web services </li><li> 3 or more years of experience with SQL or NoSQL DBMSs </li><li> 5 or more years of experience in roles that required strong interpersonal communication and collaboration skills </li><li> 5 or more years of experience in roles that required strong analytical and problem-solving skills </li><li> 3 or more years of demonstrated technical leadership skills </li><li> 2 or more years of experience with Agile and Extreme Programming (XP) software development practices like TDD </li><li> Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles. </li><li> Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority. </li><li> Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. </li><li> Experience in the Airline domain </li><li> Experience working with AWS and/or Redhat Openshift </li><li> Experience with any of the following Agile development processes: Acceptance Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Test Automation, Pair Programming <br></li></ul><strong><u>Education (or Equivalent Work Experience)<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science/Engineering related discipline</li></ul>
